title: BBC Local Live: Shropshire on Tuesday 8 March 2016 - BBC News
summary: heavy rain brings warning of more flooding .
call for tougher sentences to tackle trade in illegal diet pills .
bear-baiting jug and unusual notepad part of shropshire collection up for auction .

documents.title: our live coverage across the day
text: live updates for shropshire have finished for the day but we 'll be back from 08:00 wednesday with the latest news , sport , travel and weather .

documents.title: weather : heavy rain forecast overnight
text: we 're expecting some heavy rain overnight and the met office has issued a yellow warning for the county .
author: Charlie Slater
BBC Weather presenter

documents.title: your comments : how many more wins do shrewsbury town need ?
text: yesterday we posed the question , `` how many points do shrewsbury town need to stay up ?
harryjhill replied on twitter - `` very tough run in , esp next month .
mm should target tomorrow night and the vale game as winnable this month . ''
lee phillips commented on facebook - `` 4 more wins , 12points needed to give us 52 should do it . ''
phil lewis ( also on facebook ) agreed - `` probably 11 or 12 to be sure '' .
what do you think ?
you can also get in touch with us via email .
author: Andy Giddings
BBC Local Live

documents.title: headlines : call for tougher illegal diet-pill sentences ; heavy rain brings warnings of floods
text: these are our headlines this evening :
- call for tougher prison sentences to tackle trade in illegal diet pills
- heavy rain brings warnings of flooding
- another lorry hits a wall in ludlow
author: Andy Giddings
BBC Local Live

documents.title: another lorry hits wall near ludlow bridge
text: a fortnight after a lorry demolished part of the wall on the side of ludford bridge in ludlow , another lorry has bumped into riverside wall nearby .
ludlow town council says the truck and trailer clipped it whilst turning into nearby shops on temeside .
as you can see from this photo , the damage is n't anywhere near as bad , but the council says stones have been loosened and shropshire council engineers will be carrying out an inspection .
author: Andy Giddings
BBC Local Live

documents.title: junior doctors on strike again tomorrow
text: junior doctors are due to go on strike again at 08:00 tomorrow for 48 hours .
they 're in dispute with the government over changes to their contracts .

hospitals in shrewsbury and telford say the priority will be to keep emergency care running so some planned appointments have been postponed - but if you do n't hear anything in advance , then assume yours is going ahead .
the shrewsbury and telford hospital trust is also encouraging people to think ahead where possible and use services like the nhs111 hotline or local gps .
this latest period of industrial action is longer than those we have seen previously and we would strongly encourage people to make sure they are prepared for any disruption this may cause . ''

documents.title: oswestry advertiser front page : student slashed in college attack
text: a teenager at north shropshire college needed hospital treatment after he was slashed across the face by a fellow student .
author: Oswestry & Border Counties Advertizer

documents.title: call for more jail sentences to tackle trade in illegal diet pills
text: the local government association ( lga ) wants to see more people going to jail for selling illegal slimming pills .

almost a year after shopshire student eloise parry died from taking them , the lga says minor penalties like confiscation and fines are n't discouraging the dealers , with large amounts of money to be made .

cllr simon blackburn , the chair of the lga 's safer and stronger communities board , said there were `` frequently criminal gangs and people with very poor moral compasses '' making money from the pills .
he said most were imported from abroad and it was difficult to stop them being sold on the internet .
shutting one website down , but it does n't stop them opening another one up later in the day . ''
author: Andy Giddings
BBC Local Live

documents.title: flood alerts issued because of forecast heavy rain
text: predicted heavy rain has led the environment agency to issue a couple of flood alerts for the county , covering the upper teme , the rea brook and the cound brook .
it also warns that there could be flooding on the roads .
author: Andy Giddings
BBC Local Live

documents.title: dog owners warned about sheep-worrying
text: the police are asking dog-owners to keep tight control of their animals during lambing time .
they say that pregnant ewes are vulnerable if they get stressed and it can cause long term issues for their lambs .

there was a recent incident of sheep-worrying at frodesley and the west mercia force say that it can have a `` devastating effect '' on both farmers and dog-owners , because it can result in a court ordering a dog to be destroyed .
author: Andy Giddings
BBC Local Live

documents.title: lightbulb testing labs open in telford
text: the organisation which tests lightbulbs ( yes there is one ) has officially opened its new labs in telford today .
the big black balls below cost £ 70,000 each and are used to test the light emitted from a bulb - to make sure they conform with industry standards and do what they say on the packet .
the light industry association employs twenty staff there at the moment , but that 's expected to rise to 60 over the next two years .
and it says this facility is the largest of its type in europe .
author: Les Walton
Journalist, BBC Shropshire

documents.title: deepcut inquest hears from last people to see recruit
text: the inquest into the death of a young army recruit , whose parents live near oswestry , has heard from the last people to see her alive .

private cheryl james had been on guard duty at the gates to the deepcut base in surrey and major richard rimmington , said he said `` good morning '' , but did n't notice anything out of the ordinary .
a former regimental sergeant major also said there was `` nothing unusual '' in her response when he spoke to her at the gate that day .
she was later found dead with a gunshot wound to her head and another witness told the inquest that there was a weapon found near her body .
the inquest is scheduled to last several weeks .
author: Andy Giddings
BBC Local Live

documents.title: headlines : deepcut inquest hears from last people to see recruit ; unusual jug among items up for auction
text: here 's a recap of our top stories :
- army-death inquest hears from last people to see recruit alive
- west mercia chief constable explains his decision to retire
- bear-baiting jug and unusual notepad among shropshire collection up for auction
author: Andy Giddings
BBC Local Live

documents.title: painting with an interesting past up for auction
text: here 's another interesting item up for auction .
the man in the painting below is believed to be a member of the lee family from virginia , the family which produced the famous confederate general robert e. lee .
the oil painting ( which is valued at £ 5,000 ) has been hanging at coton hall near alveley and is being sold at auction by halls in shrewsbury next wednesday .
author: Andy Giddings
BBC Local Live

documents.title: chief constable explains his decision to step down
text: the chief constable of west mercia has been speaking about his decision to retire later this year .
david shaw has been in the job for five years now and said : there comes a time when it 's time to step aside '' .
and he explained that when a new police and crime commissioner is elected in may , he or she will need a chief constable willing to commit to four years in the job .
he does n't want to commit to that , saying `` i really feel that four year stretch would be too far '' .
author: Andy Giddings
BBC Local Live

documents.title: 'make or break ' time for shropshire sheep farmers
text: lambing season is underway for shropshire 's sheep farmers and i was at joe hamer 's farm near allscott this morning .
he described it as `` make or break '' time because the more lambs are born alive and well , the more you can sell further down the line .
and he showed me some lambs born just yesterday .
joe is quite small-scale with just 60 ewes , but he is n't too worried about the industry , saying it will naturally find its level if prices of lambs drop .
author: Ian Perry
BBC Radio Shropshire

documents.title: football : shrewsbury youngster impressed by veteran wellens
text: shrewsbury town 's jordan clarke has paid tribute to veteran midfielder richie wellens , saying `` you can always trust players like him '' .
wellens has played nearly 700 senior games and signed for the town in january and 22-year-old clarke said `` you can always learn from players like richie '' .
shrewsbury play coventry at greenhous meadow tonight , after a run of five games unbeaten .
you can hear him always talking and giving little bits of advice about getting on the ball , keeping the ball , things like that '' .

documents.title: weather watchers : grey skies over ludlow
text: we 're forecast a lot of thick cloud in shropshire today and this photo was taken by bbc weather watcher des in ludlow .
author: BBC Weather Watchers

documents.title: weather : a dry afternoon , but wet weather to come
text: it should be dry across most of the county this afternoon , but there is some wet weather to come .
author: Charlie Slater
BBC Weather presenter

documents.title: headlines : council merger idea dismissed ; chief constable explains decision to quit
text: these are our top stories this lunchtime :
- authority-merger idea dismissed by council leader
- west mercia chief constable explains his decision to retire
- stately home collection expected to fetch up to £ 1.5m at auction
author: Andy Giddings
BBC Local Live

documents.title: shropshire farmer 's plea to dog owners after horrific mauling of sheep in field
text: a shropshire sheep farmer has pleaded with dog owners to keep their animals on leads after one of her animals was killed in an attack .
author: Shropshire Star

documents.title: warning of heavy rain
text: shropshire ( and the rest of the west midlands ) could be in for some heavy rain tonight and dave throup from the environment agency has tweeted this warning .
warning for heavy overnight rain .
could be over an inch widely .
surface water flooding and smaller rivers may react .
@ twitterid that 's not the way to put a smile on our faces mr throup # morerain
author: BBC Weather

documents.title: council merger 'not going to happen '
text: plans to merge shropshire 's two councils - re-ignited by shrewsbury 's mp daniel kawczynski - have been rubbished .
labour-run telford & wrekin and tory-run shropshire council have said they wo n't become one authority .
mr kawczynski claimed it could save £ 18m , but the leader of shropshire council , malcolm pate , says it 's not on the table .
it would be a mammoth decision to make we 're not thinking that is going to happen in the foreseeable future at all
author: Joanne Gallacher
Political reporter, BBC Shropshire

documents.title: unusual bear-baiting jug part of linley hall sale
text: among the beautiful and unusual items from linley hall ( left ) which are being auctioned in london tomorrow is an unusual bear-shaped jug ( right ) .
it 's expected to sell for up to £ 900 .
the auctioneers , christie 's , say it represents chained bear which recalls the sport of bear-baiting in staffordshire .
and when you lift the head it 's a jug !
author: Andy Giddings
BBC Local Live

documents.title: football : shrewsbury v coventry
text: shrewsbury town 's assistant manager mike jackson says the team 's playing style may have to be `` functional '' rather than pretty over the last dozen games of the season .
town play coventry city at the greenhous meadow tonight after five games unbeaten .
it 's about getting results , up to now they 've done it great
zak whitbread may miss tonight 's game .
the centre-back limped off during the win at doncaster on saturday .
author: BBC Sport

documents.title: treasures from shropshire stately home up for auction
text: a collection of objects from linley hall in shropshire are being auctioned by christie 's in london tomorrow .

they include some giltwood armchairs ( below left ) and a portrait of three children and a parrot ( right ) , which is thought to represent the children of the marquise de montespan - the mistress of louix xiv .
and the other object ( top left ) is a gilt-brass and felt notepad ( better than any reporters notepad i 've owned ! )
with a compass set in the top and a secret compartment in the back .
the armchairs and the painting are expected to fetch up to £ 25,000 each and the notepad could go for up to £ 12,000 .
author: Andy Giddings
BBC Local Live

documents.title: your sunrise in gnosall
text: weather watcher 'annieste ' sent us this gorgeous of the sunrise from gnosall , near newport .
if you want to become a bbc weather watcher you can sign up here .
author: BBC Weather Watchers

documents.title: nearly 1,500 racist incidents reported in shropshire over past five years
text: nearly 1,500 racist incidents and racially motivated hate crimes have been committed in shropshire in the last five years .
author: Shropshire Star

documents.title: headlines : mother 's plea over illegal slimming pills ; council merger not on the table
text: our top stories this morning :
- mother of a shropshire student who died after taking unlicensed slimming-pills says it 's heartening people have listened to her plea for action
- plans to merge shropshire 's two councils have been rubbished
- zak whitbread may miss shrewsbury town 's game against coventry tonight
author: Carlie Swain
BBC Local Live

documents.title: solar farm idea being looked at by authority
text: shropshire council could look at building its own solar farm as it battles to save £ 61m over the next three years .
if the authority goes ahead it would be following in the footsteps of neighbouring telford and wrekin council , whose solar farm made £ 180,000 in its first year .
they may be able to help us and herefordshire and worcestershire the expertise they 've developed can be used in shropshire
author: Joanne Gallacher
Political reporter, BBC Shropshire

documents.title: on air : women who inspire you
text: it 's international women 's day today and jim hawkins wants to hear about the inspirational women in your life .
you can call jim on 01743 248321 or text 81333 starting your message with the word shrop .
or you can get in touch on twitter or facebook .
author: Jim Hawkins Show

documents.title: travel : broken down vehicle on a49
text: traffic is slow on the a49 in shrewsbury northbound , after the a5 ( preston island ) , due to a broken down vehicle .
one lane is blocked and congestion is back to emstrey island , on the a5 .
author: BBC Travel

documents.title: thousands of illegal slimming pills seized
text: the mother of a shropshire student who died after taking unlicensed slimming pills says it 's heartening people have listened to her plea for action .
trading standards teams across the country have seized hundreds of thousands of illegal slimming pills in the year since eloise parry 's death .
it 's a crime that largely has been easy to get away with and this will make a difference
the local government association wants a national campaign to warn of the dangers of taking them , and tougher penalties for criminals who sell them - often online .
author: Carlie Swain
BBC Local Live

documents.title: headlines : illegal slimming pills seized ; solar farm idea
text: here are some of the stories we 're looking at this morning :
- thousands of illegal slimming pills , including the type that killed a shropshire woman , seized across the country
- shropshire council could look at building its own solar farm
- items up for auction from linley hall expected to fetch £ 1.5m
author: Carlie Swain
BBC Local Live

documents.title: weather : a bright start , but cloudy later with rain
text: charlie slater has the latest forecast .
author: BBC Weather

documents.title: travel : slow traffic on a442 at crudgington
text: roadworks and temporary traffic lights on the a442 at the crudgington crossroads are causing delays .
author: BBC Travel

documents.title: good morning from bbc local live for shropshire
text: i 'm in the bbc shropshire newsroom with the latest news , sport , travel and weather .
if you see something we should be covering or want to share your or views , email us , tweet @ bbcshropshire or reach us on the bbc shropshire facebook page .
author: Carlie Swain
BBC Local Live
